block.p: A memorial tribute to Lincoln Kirstein, co-founder and general director emeritus of the New York City Ballet and the School of American Ballet, is to take place on Sunday at 6:30 P.M. at the New York State Theater. The event, which is open to the public, will include the performance of excerpts from George Balanchine's "Mozartiana" and "Orpheus," and children from the school will perform the Garland Dance from "The Sleeping Beauty." Peter Martins, Paul Cadmus, Kitty Carlisle Hart, Philip Johnson, Beverly Sills and Jamie Wyeth are the scheduled speakers. Information: (212) 870-5690.
